sentence: Today, I will vote to prioritize the lives of regular people over the  greed of billionaires and start bringing the Republican healthcare  crisis to an end.
title: Breaking the Gridlock Act

sentence: Speaker, I rise today in strong opposition to this woefully  inadequate spending bill that fails to decisively address the  Republican healthcare crisis and fails to extend the Affordable Care  Act tax credits for tens of millions of Americans.
title: Continuing Appropriations and Extensions Act, 2026

sentence: The style of it is: What are the  elements of the Republican healthcare crisis?
title: Censured but Not Silenced

sentence: I urge our Senate  Republican colleagues to stop stalling and extend the ACA subsidies  immediately to lower healthcare costs for millions of Americans who are  bearing the brunt of the Republican healthcare crisis.
title: Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2026

sentence: Speaker, I rise today in support of my bill to  extend the Affordable Care Act tax credits and to put an end to the  Republican healthcare crisis.
title: Breaking the Gridlock Act

sentence: How long have we heard that the Republican healthcare plan is coming?
title: Providing for Consideration of H.R. Breaking the Gridlock Act

sentence: The CR continues the Republican healthcare crisis.
title: Continuing Appropriations and Extensions Act, 2026

sentence: The Republican healthcare  crisis will make the American people wait longer for healthcare.
title: Protecting Healthcare for Millions of Americans

sentence: Speaker, every day, more Americans are being hurt by  the Republican healthcare crisis.
title: Breaking the Gridlock Act

sentence: Imagine my surprise after trying to cut  or repeal the Affordable Care Act more than 70 times, after he promised  on the campaign trail that he had ``concepts of a plan,'' whatever the  heck that is--finally, we were to see the details of the Republican  healthcare agenda for America.
title: Affordable Care Act

sentence: This is a Republican healthcare  tax hike on working families, imposed in the richest country in the  world.
title: Healthcare Crisis

sentence: It is, in effect, a Republican healthcare tax on a family in their  sixties making $100,000 a year--that is a middle-class family--in  Hartford, CT.
title: Healthcare

sentence: Several hospitals that are barely  squeaking by today have told me they will fall into the red because of  the Republican healthcare cuts in this law.
title: Healthcare

sentence: A vote for this bill is a vote for the Republican healthcare crisis.
title: Lower Health Care Premiums for All Americans Act

sentence: Nothing in  this Republican healthcare plan will stop Americans' healthcare  premiums from skyrocketing.
title: Lower Health Care Premiums for All Americans Act

sentence: To call this, and I have heard it said a couple of times already, a  Republican healthcare crisis is fake news.
title: Breaking the Gridlock Act
